poem:
**New Forest Troth**

In ancient scripts of tail and mane,  
free yet tethered by silent claim.  
Whose hoofmarks print on sylvan stage,  
not wild, but owned by commoner's age.  
In patterns clipped, their lineage named,  
branded whispers in tree-ringed frame.  
A wild tale told by tethered flight,  
forest's breath in morning light.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Branded New Forest ponies are well cared for | Letter Jason Rose objects to the traditional care and management of New Forest ponies (Letters, 29 September). Different cuts of tail (a harmless practice) determine which agister (local official) they fall". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
